Key Features:
- Full backward compatibility with existing ThemeManager API
- Seamless delegation to UnifiedThemeManager
- Enhanced error handling and logging

class LegacyThemeManager(QObject):
    """
    Enhanced legacy ThemeManager compatibility class.

    Provides full backward compatibility for all existing ThemeManager usage

theme_manager_usage.context: Provides full backward compatibility for all existing ThemeManager usage
theme_manager_usage.code_snippet:
Enhanced legacy ThemeManager compatibility class.

    Provides full backward compatibility for all existing ThemeManager usage
    while delegating to the UnifiedThemeManager for actual implementation.

# Backward compatibility aliases
ThemeManager = LegacyThemeManager

theme_manager_usage.code_snippet:
New capabilities:
- ThemeManager singleton with fallback color handling, logging, CSS template processing,
  widget registry, JSON save/load, export/import, processed CSS caching.
"""

class ThemeManager:
    """
    ThemeManager provides:
    - Central color registry with descriptive variable names
    - Fallback handling for undefined variables (returns FALLBACK_COLOR, logs WARNING)

"""

    _instance: Optional["ThemeManager"] = None

    VARIABLE_PATTERN = re.compile(r"\{\{\s*([A-Za-z0-9_]+)\s*\}\}")

theme_manager_usage.context: Values are resolved from ThemeManager at access time.
theme_manager_usage.code_snippet:
"""
    Proxy object to allow f-string usage like f\"color: {COLORS.text};\"
    Values are resolved from ThemeManager at access time.
    """

def __getattr__(self, name: str) -> str:
        return ThemeManager.instance().get_color(name, context="COLORS_proxy")

"""
    Proxy object to allow f-string usage like f"color: {COLORS.text};"
    Values are resolved from ThemeManager at access time.
    """

def __getattr__(self, name: str) -> str:
        return ThemeManager.instance().get_color(name, context="COLORS_proxy")

theme_manager_usage.context: Provides the ThemeManager singleton class for managing colors, presets,
theme_manager_usage.code_snippet:
Core theme management system.

Provides the ThemeManager singleton class for managing colors, presets,
CSS processing, widget registration, and theme persistence.
"""

class ThemeManager:
    """
    ThemeManager provides:
    - Central color registry with descriptive variable names
    - Fallback handling for undefined variables (returns FALLBACK_COLOR, logs WARNING)

"""

    _instance: Optional["ThemeManager"] = None
    VARIABLE_PATTERN = re.compile(r"\{\{\s*([A-Za-z0-9_]+)\s*\}\}")

def update_from_theme(self) -> None:
        """Update button style from current theme color."""
        tm = ThemeManager.instance()
        hex_val = tm.get_color(self.var_name, context="ColorRow")
        self._apply_button_style(hex_val)
